intro: Diodia angolensis, commonly known as African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes. Diodia angolensis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its striking appearance and resilience.
